metadata.title: CVE-2022-3550 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability classified as critical was found in X.org Server. Affectedby this vulnerability is the function _GetCountedString of the filexkb/xkb.c. The manipulation leads to buffer overflow. It is recommended toapply a patch to fix this issue. The associated identifier of thisvulnerability is VDB-211051.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xdmx-tools - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xnest - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xorg-server-source - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xserver-common - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
xvfb - 2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.15.1-0ubuntu2.11+esm6').
xorg-server-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xorg-server-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
